title: Controlled Synthesis of Pt-Ni Bimetallic Catalysts and Study of
description:
Controlled Synthesis of Pt-Ni Bimetallic Catalysts and Study of Their Catalytic Properties - Yuen Wu (Springer, 2016).pdf

ISBN 978-3-662-49845-3

This thesis focuses on the controlled synthesis of Ptâ€“Ni bimetallic nanoparticles and the study of their catalytic properties. It discusses in detail the nucleation mechanism and the growth process of bimetallic systems, which is vital for a deeper understanding of the design of bimetallic catalysts. The author presents four pioneering studies: (1) syntheses of water-soluble octahedral, truncated octahedral, and cubic Ptâ€“Ni nanocrystals and the study of their structure-activity relationship in model hydrogenation reactions; (2) a strategy for designing a concave Ptâ€“Ni alloy using controllable chemical etching; (3) defect-dominated shape recovery of nanocrystals, which is a new synthesis strategy for trimetallic catalysts; (4) a sophisticated construction of Au islands on Ptâˆ’Ni, which is an ideal trimetallic nanoframe catalyst. This thesis inspires researchers working in materials, catalysis as well as other interdisciplinary areas
